metadata.title: CVE-2020-25708 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A divide by zero issue was found to occur in libvncserver-0.9.12. Amalicious client could use this flaw to send a specially crafted messagethat, when processed by the VNC server, would lead to a floating pointexception, resulting in a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25708` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.4
libvncserver-config - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.4
libvncserver1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

vino - 3.22.0-3ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.4').
vino package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.22.0-3ubuntu1.2').
x11vnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
italc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
tightvnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
